scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-226 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-226 is a star with 0.91 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.8 times its radius. It is located 3196.78 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-226 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-226 system


Kepler-226 b

Kepler-226 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-226 b is 24.168 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-226 b is 1.550 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-226 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


Kepler-226 c

Kepler-226 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-226 c is 45.156 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-226 c is 2.270 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-226 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


Kepler-226 d

Kepler-226 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-226 d is 1.984 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-226 d is 1.220 that of Earth. At 1.984 Earth masses, Kepler-226 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-226, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-226 - System With 3 Exolanets
